{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561531,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T11:34:47.269Z","cooked":"

Hey, so I have a pose estimator and it is relatively accurate, but I want to be able to vary starting position slightly and still have it work. The easiest way to do this is with vision measurements, but I have no clue what to do about adding them. Code is here: GitHub - metrobots/Metrobots.25, and all of the pose estimation is in drivetrain

Looks like you are using limelight. I suggest you to create vision subsystem(not required but it will be better if you do that). There is an example at the limelight docs. You can implement from here.

Where can I find the apriltag fieldmap? And is it safe to use it when only one tag is visible?

If you are using the latest firmware it is already on the limelight.

But it is here…

docs.limelightvision.io

Downloads | Limelight Documentation

Limelight Hardware Manager

You’ll want the welded/original one for MVR.

Yes, you can restrict to find one.

This should get you started:

docs.limelightvision.io

Robot Localization with MegaTag2 | Limelight Documentation

Introduced in 2024, Megatag2 is a precise and ambiguity-free AprilTag-based localizer for mobile robots. It was built with the following goals:
